title: Unable to save your message as a draft. Sending of the message failed. After Thunderbird crashed. Windows 10
content:
I made the mistake of trying to run message filters on an inbox of about 34000 emails and thunderbird started saying 'Unable to send mail' and froze up for a long time. I had to use Task Manager to close it and then reboot the PC to get back into Thunderbird. Now I can't send emails or save drafts. I've tried repairing folders and compacting. I've tried deleting the drafts folder from the profile and I've tried pointing the account to a different drafts folder. I'm still stuck.

PS. This is my managers email I've broken while he is on holiday so he will have to be able to send emails when he gets back next week.
creator: jwk630

title: invio mail a gmail
content: Buongiorno, da questa mattina le mail che inviamo a indirizzi gmail.com non vengono consegnate al destinatario e ci ritorna il seguente messaggio: This message was created automatically by mail delivery software. A message that you sent could not be delivered to one or more of its recipients. This is a permanent error. The following address(es) failed: ecc... Potete esserci di aiuto? Le abbiamo sempre inviate fino a ieri senza problemi... Le riceviamo soltanto da gmail.com, abbiamo provato. In attesa ringraziamo anticipatamente

title: No writable calendars are configured ...
content:
Hi, I've the same issue as already reported a year ago here: https://support.mozilla.org/bm/questions/1358434

Thunderbird apparently only partially supports addon-provided calendars. When I get an E-Mail with an Invite or Appointment, it says: "No wirable calendars are configured for invitations, please check the calendar properties." But for addon calendars it is not possible to assign an e-mail address. And even if it was, I wouldn't be able to assign it to multiple mail accounts.

However, when I save the attached ics file and then open it with Thunderbird, I'm able to select my calendar. It would be nice to skip the save the attachment and reopen it in Thunderbird part and just be able to add the appointment to the calendars...

title: Thunderbird -- "hard" string search
content:
It took me forever to get to this box -- more on that later

-- first Thunderbird "Hard" string search !!!

I often (very often) need to do a "hard" string search in Thunderbird -- to look for ONLY an exact string of characters -- and nada mas.

How do I search ALL my emails -- -- in ALL my folders to look for ONLY -- -- "excel" -- and NOT get a return of ANYTHING else -- -- I DO NOT want to see any "excellence" or excellent or ANYTHING except ONLY these five characters in -- "excel"

How do I do that?

P.S. Don't we want meer mortals to use OSS (Open source software) or public infrastructure software as I often call it -- and not JUST computer geeks? Why wouldn't we make it EASY -- very easy -- to get to this point (with no log-in) to encourage the use of OSS instead of Black box software?

Thanks, [removed email from public]
creator: druw

title: Thunderbird address book download
content: I launch TBird, then click on Tools and launch Address Bk by clicking on it here; select the book I want and under Edit pick Select All; under Tools click Export and get a page "Export: Export Accounts, Messages, Address Books, and Settings to a ZIP file". If I click on the next step on this page, it takes me to "Export to a ZIP file". At nowhere in the steps is there an option to select going to a Flash Drive or to select CSV, ldif or v-card. I am trying to download to flash drive as backup and to update my TBird program on a lap top.
creator: dpfaff696

title: One pixel high dialog blocking use
content:
When I run the menu option "run filters on folder", after a while the status bar stops updating (it shows something like "Moved X messages from Inbox to Folder A" and Thunderbird becomes unresponsive to mouse clicks or keyboard. However the mouse wheel does work, scrolling through the folders tree view. Looking very closely it looks like there something like a one pixel high dialog on the screen but trying to send Enter or esc to it makes no difference. Clicking on it makes it flash as if it's being redrawn. I've captured a short video to demonstrate. https://Navigator.tinytake.com/msc/ODYwMDIxOF8yMTk1NDIyMw Once this happens the only solution is to kill the task via task manager.

[later] I have eventually managed to resize this one pixel high dialog (using some old forgotten keyboard shortcuts), but it's just a grey dialog with no text (see image).

Oddly if I close it, then I can redirect the mouse scroll bar to either the folder pane, the inbox pane or the actual message pane by clicking in them, but I can't click on any specific folder/email, nor on the menus. Closing the dialog doesn't allow the filters to continue.

Any suggestions/solutions ? I'm running in Troubleshooter mode.
creator: dsr2

title: email selection indication
content:
I'm using Thunderbird 115.1.1. When I select (single click) an email from the list, the selection is obvious because the background text color for that email's details turns blue. When I then click Delete, I know which email will be deleted because it is selected (blue text background).

But after Deleting that email, the email selection goes away (no more blue text background). So it is unclear which email is selected. But there IS a selected email that will be removed on the next Delete (the next one after the deleted one). Why doesn't the "selected" indication (blue text background) move to the selected email?

title: local mailboxes
content:
Hi. I've installed TB 115.1.1 (64-bit) on my Mac OS11.7.9. I've actually used its predecessor, Eudora, since 1993, including on a virtual machine the past decade or more; but in a few weeks Eudora will no longer be accepted for use by my institution due to outdated security protocols. I've been studying online TB documentation but remain confused on multiple issues.

One of the reasons I used Eudora for so long was because I could locally store outgoing and incoming emails so as to work with them when offline (airplanes, etc.) I'd archive the two boxes twice a year, renaming them, so as to keep my primary in and out box small enough to function smoothly. Thus I have 50 or so archived in boxes across decades, and another 50 or so outboxes. I keep all but the last year's on an external drive but rely on accessing the immediate past year's archived boxes simply by reaching into Eudora's Mailbox menu and choosing one to examine.

I'm starting fresh with TB and have created Local Folders, apparently, for my Sent and In boxes; so that would seem a good start.

(1) Will I forever have just one of each, growing eternally; or, as in Eudora, can I periodically export or copy contents to an additional, createable box that I can then access at will via some TB menu option? The documentation I've read in Help regarding Global Inboxes, Unified Folders, and more have my head spinning.

(2) I do have my preceding Eudora archived boxes on my computer. They sit as "Unix Executable File" format but are read immediately by Eudora. Would I be able to point TB to those periodically to read and search them, or will those files never be readable by TB?

(3) I am willing to reformat my Eudora address book contents manually as needed for TB. But I have exported it from Eudora into several formats, including csv and Excel. Should I just import one of those into TB and see what it does, or is there an example of expected entry formatting I should observe.

(4) For my eyes, in Eudora I displayed fonts at size 22 and printed 12. No matter what I set in TB preferences, the visual result remains small (looks like size 12 to me).

That's it for now. Apologies for any denseness exhibited above!

Best,

Tony
creator: ajgarcia2

I have some shared folders when the mailbox is e.g. shared@domain.com but I need to sign in using me@domain.com as login, because the account is mine, not the shared's one.

I think there is some bug in the url generated when TB starts signin process to Microsoft's OID endpoint, where it is required an access as "shared@domain.com" blocking it.

All was ok until the upgrade.

thanks
creator: baz

title: Thunderbird se bloquea al descargar mensajes
content:
Hola, mi problema consiste en que cada vez que abro Thunderbird, si hay mensajes nuevos en el servidor, aparecen enseguida en la bandeja de entrada; se aplican los filtros, parece que todos los mensajes se indizan y colocan en las carpetas correspondientes, pero entonces el programa se bloquea porque el proceso de descarga de los mensajes se vuelve lentísimo, se puede ver la barra azul de descarga y la etiqueta "descargando mensaje 1 de N" y no se puede hacer nada, si se intenta sale el mensajito de Windows que indica "no responde"; no obstante, al cabo de un rato el mensaje por fin se descarga y se puede trabajar con total normalidad. Para hacerse una idea del problema, esto pasa cada vez que hay mensajes: si estoy trabajando con Thunderbird y llega un correo, de repente todo se "congela" hasta que se ha descargado dicho correo, esto puede tardar solo unos cuantos segundos (pero demasiados comparados con la velocidad normal del programa) pero en cuanto son varios porque el programa ha estado tiempo sin abrirse, entonces el bloqueo dura minutos. Ayer volví de vacaciones y al abrir el correo, con casi 100 en la bandeja de entrada, estuvo toda la noche inutilizado el programa, descargando los mensajes. En cuanto estuvieron todos listos, funcionó con normalidad.

He probado algunas de las opciones más visibles en internet y foros, como desactivar las opciones de indexación de mensajes o borrar el archivo de base de datos, pero no ha funcionado nada.

El programa está actualizado (versión 102.14.0 (64-bit)) y mi sistema operativo es Windows 11 Home 22H2 (versión del SO: 22621.2134).

Muchas gracias de antemano por cualquier orientación, un saludo.
creator: litoskar
